definition: frame (e.g. door frame)/casing/fig. framework/template/to circle (i.e. draw a circle around sth)/to frame/to restrict/Taiwan pr. [kuang1]
frame (e.g. door frame)/casing/fig. framework/template/to circle (i.e. draw a circle around sth)/to frame/to restrict/Taiwan pr. [kuang1]
fixed framework (idiom); restriction of social conventions and taboos (usually derogatory)/regulations and restrictions

sentences.english: Shed old ideas about who you are and what you're capable of.
sentences.chinese: 摆脱关于你是谁与你能够做什么的旧框框。

sentences.english: Similarly create six more duplicate frames and unhide the third line for these frames.
sentences.chinese: 再复制这六个帧并将框框中的文字显示为第三段文字。

sentences.english: The shingles used to mount the mirror were blown off roofs in storms.
sentences.chinese: 安装镜头的框框是从飓风从房项吹出的木瓦。

sentences.english: I was encouraged to break away from old forms and rules.
sentences.chinese: 大家鼓励我破除旧形式和旧框框。

sentences.english: The origin of language theories can never amount to much more than educated conjecture.
sentences.chinese: 语言起源理论总不会超过其学术性推测的框框。

sentences.english: The key thing is to emancipate our minds and break away from convention .
sentences.chinese: 我们的人才是有的，关键是要解放思想，打破框框。

sentences.english: Well they broke my frame. Washington D. C.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，美国，他已经将我的框框撑破。

sentences.english: They opposed the creation of a lot of restrictions to tie the hands of the masses.
sentences.chinese: 他们反对定出许多条条框框来捆住群众的手脚。

sentences.english: There aren’t as many rules and restrictions.
sentences.chinese: 这里没有太多的条条框框和限制。

sentences.english: I’m not filling the board with check boxes.
sentences.chinese: 我不会用些条条框框来筛选人填充董事会。

sentences.english: Bureaucracy spawns many rules that complicate our life.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主义产生了使生活化的条条框框。

sentences.english: We should break down old conventions and think big.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该打破旧框框，敢于幻想。

sentences.english: Rimless frame with Austrian crystal detail at temples.
sentences.chinese: 无框框架奥地利水晶详细的庙宇。

sentences.english: Domestically too we have to open wider, invigorate the economy and not be restricted by conventional thinking.
sentences.chinese: 对内也要开放搞活，不要固守一成不变的框框。

sentences.english: He revolted against the principles and norms of his time, he died young and he was a libertine," co-producer Albert Cohen said.
sentences.chinese: 他反抗当时的条条框框，还是个英年早逝的浪子。

sentences.english: Dealing with deflation is impossible within the bounds of normal market operations.
sentences.chinese: 在常规市场运行的框框内应对通缩是不可能的事情。

definition: fixed framework (idiom); restriction of social conventions and taboos (usually derogatory)/regulations and restrictions
frame (e.g. door frame)/casing/fig. framework/template/to circle (i.e. draw a circle around sth)/to frame/to restrict/Taiwan pr. [kuang1]
blank/blank space on a form/space/囗 (indicating missing or illegible character)
checked pattern/square box character (in Chinese text) indicating illegible character
